```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(sf)
library(kableExtra)
library(tidyr)
library(dplyr)
library(stringr)
```

## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r data}
nightlights <- st_read("./data/nightlights_constituency.shp")
volatility <- st_read("./data/volatility_constituency.csv")
```

```{r nightlight_delta}
for (i in 1993:1993) {
  prev_year <- paste0("ng_", i - 1)
  year <- paste0("ng_", i)
  nightlights[paste0("ngdelta_", i)] <- (nightlights[[year]] - nightlights[[prev_year]]) / nightlights[[prev_year]] * 100
}
for (i in 2015:2019) {
  prev_year <- paste0("ng_", i - 1)
  year <- paste0("ng_", i)
  nightlights[paste0("ngdelta_", i)] <- (nightlights[[year]] - nightlights[[prev_year]]) / nightlights[[prev_year]] * 100
}
```

``` {r means}
volatility <- volatility%>%
  filter(Year > 2015)%>%
  mutate(State_Name = gsub(" ", "_", State_Name))%>%
  mutate(Year = as.numeric(Year))%>%
  mutate(Constituency_No = as.numeric(Constituency_No))%>%
  mutate(Assembly_No = as.numeric(Assembly_No))

kable(head(nightlights))
kable(head(volatility))
```

``` {r newmerge}
sf_use_s2(FALSE)
final <- inner_join(nightlights, volatility, by = c("State_Name" = "State_Name", "ASSEMBLY" = "Constituency_No", "ASSEMBLY_1" = "Constituency_Name"))
kable(head(final))
kable(nrow(final))
```

``` {r write}
final <- final%>%
  mutate(volatility = as.numeric(volatility))%>%
  mutate(ngdelta_2019 = as.numeric(ngdelta_2019))
st_write(final, "./data/final_tcpdjson.shp", delete_dsn = T)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
